STOP'S PERIMETER A FEW HUNDRED YARDS OUT.

text: Everything in the diner is suddenly cast in DARK RED as t day's remaining sunlight filters through the swarm. Apocalyptic. No one breathes.

head_text.subj: A BLACK HAND AND A HOOK TEAR A SHIRT OPEN

text: Revealing a bloody mess of muscles and tendons chewed dow the bone.
Percy and Charlie are tending to Howard. Sandra is holdin her husband's hand, trying to comfort him, while Audrey watches from a distance with grim fascination.
(raises a bottle of
Okay, hold `em steady.
(nods, peakish, to
Oh god, please don't throw up.

Howard writhes as Percy pours alcohol on the wound. Sandra can't help but stare at Percy's hook. Meanwhile across the diner, Bob and Jeep peel back the tablecloth to examine Gladys' bullet riddled corpse. Kyle stands over them with Bob's shotgun trained on the body - just in case. Gladys is a real horror show. Bones jut out at obtuse ang from her neck -- a result of the blow to her head from Percy's frying pan.
She's cold as a freakin' ice cube. If I hadn't just seen her walk in here, I'd say the old bag's been dead for hours.
Bob rolls Gladys over, revealing her face -- her enlarged mouth filled with dozens of razor sharp baby teeth.
Well, I don't care how long she's been dead, the bitch ain't stayin' in here with us.
Bob, Kyle and Jeep quickly drag Gladys's body wrapped in plastic table cloth a short ways from the diner. They war eye the curtain of FLIES no more than a hundred yards out
I don't get it.    Why don't they come closer?
How the fuck am I supposed to know, man? You askin' me to explain the behavior of a motherfuckin' pestilence.
A CLANK and Jeep notices the old lady's car keys have dro to the ground.
(holding up the keys) You guys!
Its windows are completely caked with dust. The men WIPE AWAY a layer of brown from the glass, allowing them to pe inside the car.
You see anything?
No Twilight Zone shit if that's what you mean.
Jeep slips the key into the driver's side door.     Unloc
Careful. Old lady could have some kind of rabid poodle locked up in there.
Jeep slowly swings the door open and that's when the smel hits them.
Agh!   What the fuck is that?
Bob covers his nose.
Jesus.
Kyle opens the passenger door, looks in.      Dark, dirty nothing unusual.
Nothin' here.
How `bout the trunk?

They go around to the BACK OF THE CAR.   Jeep slips the k in. The trunk POPS open, revealing a PILE OF DEAD CATS.   ROT MAGGOT INFESTED. Bob quickly slams the trunk closed.    The guys are reeli with disgust. Kyle's trying to blow the stench from his nose.
Bitch's got motherfuckin' dead cats in her hoopty! What the fuck is wrong with white people?!
Least now we know where that smell was coming from.
Yeah, it was a real motherfuckin' necessity we figured that out, man.
(sees something up the
Hey...

They turn to see HEADLIGHTS growing larger in the dim haz A POLICE CRUISER careens off the highway and skids to a w stop in front of the diner. Its ENGINE RATTLES as the dus clears around it. No movement can be seen behind its bug splattered windows.
Okay, now we're talkin'.
Wait a minute. Check it out. It's LAPD. What's an LA cop doing way out here?
Bob and Jeep look over at Kyle.
I'm from Nevada, man.
They consider the police car a moment more. See the SHATTERED PASSENGER WINDOW, the BLOOD STAINS.
Give me the shotgun.
Kyle hands the shotgun over to Bob.
Charlie's face lights up when she sees the police car.
Oh, thank God, the police!
The door of the POLICE CAR OPENS as Charlie races from th diner. The three men see her moving toward the car.    Jeep's fa goes slack.
Charlie, wait!
The men begin to run toward her... While out of the police car steps...

Charlie freezes a few feet from the car when she sees tho piercing eyes already familiar to us. Michael looks at he as if she was exactly who he expected to see. In moments Bob, Kyle and Jeep form a protective shield in front of Charlie. Bob raises the shotgun.
Take one step closer and I'll drop you right here.
A long beat as Michael considers Bob.   Icy cold.
That how you greet all your customers?
Mister, after what we've been through here today, you're lucky we didn't shoot you first and greet you later. Now let me see your teeth.
Michael stares at him blankly.
Your teeth goddamn it!       Lemme see `em!
Michael offers up a dangerous smile, revealing a not so w kept but definitely normal set of teeth. Bob and the othe ease slightly.
No, shark teeth, Pop.
Bob lowers the gun.
Okay... Suppose you tell us your name then.
Michael.
Sorry about all that, Michael. This old lady just went crazy inside my place here. She had these teeth. Never seen anything like `em. Practically bit a man in half.
Michael remains silent.       Doesn't seemed shocked in t by what he's heard.

So what are you doin' out here? Gotta say you don't exactly look like a police officer. Even one from L.A. Then again, you have to be, right? I mean, who the hell'd be crazy enough to steal a cop car?

Bob chuckles for a moment. When Michael doesn't respond i kind, Bob falls silent. Anxious. He slowly raises the shotgun again. Michael sizes up this raggedy group. His gaze drifts over the loosely wrapped body in front of the diner. The plast table cloth flaps wildly in the wind. Turning back to Bob
You don't know, do you?
Know what?
We don't know anything. Nothing's working here. The TV, the radio, the phone...
Michael just shakes his head.
I'm running out of time.
Michael steps toward Charlie with a sense of purpose, but blocks his path, brandishing the shotgun.
Back off, fella... (BEAT) Now, I don't care if this is the second coming of Jesus fucking Christ, I say it's time for you to either get talkin' or get the hell outta here!

In a BLUR OF MOVEMENT, Michael rips the shotgun from Bob' hands. It all happens so fast that Bob is stunned to find himself holding air. He's even more stunned to now have the barrel of the gun pressed to the bridge of his nose. Everyone freezes.
Easy!   Easy!
Michael's expression is totally calm.   Merciless.
C'mon, Dad, tell `em you're sorry. Tell `em you were only kidding!
But Bob can't even speak, he's so scared.   He squeezes h eyes closed.
Let `em go!

Michael's eyes flit momentarily in Charlie's direction. Considering her. The diner door opens and Percy steps cautiously out with and hook held up to show no threat. He's followed by Sand and Audrey. Michael sees them, but offers no indication that he cares

Now, son, I'm sure you don't wanna go spillin' blood for no good reason in front of all these decent people, do ya? Our friend Bob here ain't worth the trouble it'd cause ya. (BEAT) So whaddya say `bout just lettin' `im go and then you can be on your way? Nice `n' easy.

But Michael doesn't seem to register this plea.   It's no looking good. No one BREATHES. That's when Kyle notices something out i the direction of the road. DOZENS OF TINY HEADLIGHTS APPEARING IN THE DARK HAZE. APPROACHING.
What the--?
Michael turns, sees the lights.
They're here.
Michael whips the gun away from Bob's head and thrusts it back into his hands. Bob's looks down at the gun, speechless.
You're going to need this.
Michael walks swiftly around to the trunk of the cruiser. Pops it, revealing a staggering ARSENAL OF WEAPONRY. HE BEGINS TO LOAD GUN AFTER GUN. Percy stares out at the lights, eyes wide.
Lord, have mercy. (waving back Audrey and
You ladies best get back inside.
What is it? What's happening? Who is this man? Why's he driving a police car?
Shut up, mom!
Audrey pulls her mother back into the diner. Michael hands an MP5 SUB-MACHINE GUN to Kyle. Another one goes to Percy. Finally he places a third one in Jeep's hands, who stares down at it anxiously.
Wait. I don't think that's such a good idea.
Dad, I can handle it.
(to Michael) He's just a kid --
I said, I can handle it!
Michael's eyes narrow, studying Jeep.
He can handle it. He doesn't have a choice.
Michael pulls out twin MP5s for himself. GLOCK 9s are tuc everywhere they can go. Michael tosses clip belts to the men. Boxes of shotgun shells. The works.
If you want to live, you'll do exactly as I say.
He slams the trunk closed and approaches Charlie.   He co Glock and hands it to her.
When you fire, you keep your thumb off the slide. Don't hesitate. Don't do anything brave. There's no safety.

He gives her a hard look.   She nods nervously.   Trustin but not sure why. Michael marches into the diner. Kyle glances quickly at t others, then he bolts after Michael. Percy follows.   Then Charlie. Now it's only Jeep and his father left.
C'mon, Jeep. We gotta go!
And Bob rushes into the diner. A moment as Jeep looks out toward the road. THE HEADLIGHTS ARE GROWING BRIGHTER.       CLOSER. He contemplates the sub-machine gun in his hands.
Fuck it.
And races after his father.
Thrown.   Locking the diner door.
Frantic activity. Kyle and Michael push a booth in front the door, sealing off the entrance. Tables are turned on their sides to form makeshift shield Window blinds are snap closed.
Jeep races in, locks the back door.       Then he pushes front of it.

The place is transformed. Locked up tight.        The ROA ENGINES outside grows ever LOUDER, CLOSER. Sandra huddles on the floor with Howard, his head in her She's running her hands gently through his hair, trying t keep calm. He opens his eyes. Pale, weak from blood loss.
Sandra?    What's happening?
It's okay!     Everything's okay!
Sandra closes her eyes.        Struggling to believe it. Suddenly the ELECTRICITY GOES OUT, dipping the room into DARKNESS.
We hear CRIES OF ALARM.   TOTAL BLACK.   Chaos.
Jeep, get the flashlights!
Everybody just stay still!
Now that we're locked in here, what the fuck are we supposed to do?
A flicker of LIGHT. And then FLASHLIGHT BEAMS CUT THROUGH THE DARKNESS...coming to rest on Michael's pale face. Michael looks up at the ceiling.

A hatch opens and out comes Michael followed by Bob, Perc and Kyle. They quickly take their places behind the "Paradise" sign. Pitch black surrounds them. The RUMBLE OF ENGINES is gone, leaving only the RUSH OF T WIND coming up off the desert.
Where the hell did they go?
Bob turns to Michael sharply.
Alright, Rambo. You got us up here. Now you mind explaining what the fuck we're fighting?
Michael is about to answer, when:
Listen!
Over the wind, another sound becomes audible. The delicate chime of a CALLIOPE.
You hear what I'm hearing?
Yeah...The hell is that?
The CALLIOPE MUSIC grows louder, the melody more distinct Now we recognize the song: SANTA CLAUS IS COMING TO TOWN. But instead of filling them with cheer, it fills them wit dread.
It sounds almost like...
Ice cream.

TWO HEADLIGHTS appear in the   darkness. And sure enough, ICE CREAM TRUCK rolls slowly   toward the diner. The EERI CALLIOPE MUSIC emanates from   a speaker on its roof. It' dark to see who's behind the   wheel.
You've got to be fuckin' kidding me.
Alright. There's a safety switch on the side of your gun. Push it all the way down. Two clicks.
The men quickly do as they're told.
Now when this starts, you hold on tight, you hear me? If you don't, you're going to blow your hand off. Understand?
Kyle, Bob shoot quick anxious looks at Percy.
The fuck y'all lookin' at me for?

Jeep faces the boarded up front door, awkwardly holding t MP5, trying to assume a tough guy posture. If only he cou stop shaking, it might be believable. Charlie and Audrey peer between the slats covering the windows. The ICE CREAM TRUCK'S HEADLIGHTS fan across the diner. Audrey and Charlie back away from the windows. Charlie stops next to Jeep. Senses him shaking. Rests a hand on his arm. And that seems to help...a little. Howard smiles weakly at the familiar sound of the CALLIOP
Oh, honey, listen.    It's the Ice Cream Man.

The Ice Cream Truck pulls to a stop with its headlights facing the diner. Everyone aims their guns at the truck.     Tense. From the Ice Cream Truck...a DARK BLOODY SHOE STEPS to th ground. MOVING up the long grey pant leg spotted with blood stain reveal a skeletally thin man in tattered coveralls. Say hello to THE ICE CREAM MAN. He looks like he's been through hell -- literally. As he steps into the beams of the headlights we can see him eve more clearly. He's tall. Too tall. His clothes don't seem to fit him. And he's unnaturally thin as if he's been stretched like taffy. If he got down on all fours, you might mistake him for some kind of spider. He surveys the diner, the garage the roof -- assessing the situation. On the roof, the men wait for something to happen.
(WHISPERS) Ah, he don't look that bad.
The Ice Cream Man's gaze snaps up to the roof.      He he
Oh, shit.     Oh, shit.   Oh, shit.
That's when the Ice Cream Man's JAW UNHINGES, STRETCHING

head_text.subj: TORTUROUSLY DOWN TO NEARLY THE MIDDLE OF HIS CHEST

text: AFTER ROW OF A RAZOR SHARP TEETH FORM with the sickening sound of CRACKING OF BONES. From his new mouth, the Ice Cream Man lets out an earth shattering HOWL. Everyone except Michael is practically hyperventilating w fear.
Get ready!
And the ICE CREAM MAN BOLTS for the diner with STARTLING SPEED! His movements aren't at all like those of a normal man, but rather like some kind of HUMAN INSECT. Michael aims.
Bullets rip into the creature's body, knocking him flat o his back. Still. Arms and legs in a twisted, twitching mess. Michael keeps his aim.    Waits.   The CALLIOPE music con to play.
Is that it?
Not even close. A RUMBLING OF ENGINES. HEADLIGHTS. A freeway full of VEHICLES of every variety punch through t wall of dust, racing toward the diner. They are THE COMMUTERS.
Now!   Shoot now!
The men let loose with FEROCIOUS FIREPOWER.
Vehicles swerve and COLLIDE! DARK SHAPES bolt from the burning vehicles, scattering. In the FLASH OF BATTLE we catch glimpses of them: BUSINES

head_text.subj: PEOPLE. CONSTRUCTION WORKERS. EVEN AN ENTIRE HIGH SCHOOL

text: FOOTBALL TEAM. All deformed by some demonic force. Many mere BALLS OF FLAME drifting through the darkness.
Spread out! Don't let them get close to the windows!

The DARK SHAPES converge on the diner from all directions They move so strangely fast it seems that their feet don' actually touch the ground. From the roof it's a full-on turkey shoot as the men foll Michael's instructions and cut down everything in sight. Their faces lighting up with each FLASH. SHELL CASINGS spray from their weapons like water drops f a sprinkler. BODIES BURST and crumble to the dirt. The creatures don't seem to be afraid of dying. Their strategy appears to be their sheer numbers. With each wave, the dark figures get ever closer to the diner.
ON BOB firing madly.    Then...   CLICK!   CLICK!   Oh, n out of ammo.
Shells!
Percy tosses him a box of shells. But Bob fumbles the cat and the box slides halfway down the sloped roof.
Fuck!
With the gun still in one hand, Bob reaches frantically d for the ammo. Stretching... Further...

head_text.subj: A HIDEOUSLY WOUNDED MIDDLE-AGED HOUSEWIFE CATAPULTS UP FR

text: BELOW THE ROOFLINE! Her hair must have been in curlers before most of it BURNED AWAY. Her nightdress hangs in tatters off her body. Her jaw CLICKS RAPIDLY, as she clatters up at Bob like a GIANT INSECT. Bob tries to pull back, but he has no traction and he sta to slip down toward her. She's coming fast! Percy sees his friend in trouble.
Bob!
Bob swings the shotgun like a club -- CRACK! -- knocking bitch clear off the roof. But the move has made his slide even faster. He drops the shotgun, trying to hold on, but can't stop!

head_text.subj: BOB IS ABOUT TO HIT THE EDGE WHEN THE HORRID WOMAN POPS U

text: She doesn't even have a chance to react as Bob does somet akin to a swimmer's push right off her body! WHAM! The creature goes flying back off the roof and the opposi force halts Bob's slide.
(extending his hook) Grab my hand!
Bob reaches up and clasps Percy's hook, praying that it s on. But this chick ain't finished yet. Up she comes once more Her razor sharp fingernails claw up the metal roof. SCREE
Gun!
Percy tosses Bob a Glock. Fortunately this time Bob deftl catches it with his free hand just as the deranged woman pounces on him.
(jamming the gun in her
Fuck off!
BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! The back of her head EXPLODES. Her body goes limp. Bob struggles to push the corpse off of him.
Pull me up!
Percy extends his hook hand, helping Bob ascend to safety

Hiding in the shadows... listening to sounds of WAR just outside. Sandra squeezes her hands over her ears.   A few feet awa Audrey clutches a butcher's knife. Jeep's eyes darting from one window to another.   Trying keep it together. Charlie is crouched down behind the counter, holding the handgun close to her pregnant belly. Distant EXPLOSIONS rattle the plates on the shelves. Charlie peers out from behind the counter to look at the front windows. Momentary FLASHES of intense light outline the closed bli Another FLASH lights up Charlie's face.    Staring.
Percy is swivelling left and right, firing like mad.
Come on, motherfuckers!   Come on!
Closer and closer the creatures come.   Most are eviscera by the fire from the rooftop.

ON CHARLIE staring at the window.    CLOSER.   Charlie's wide as -- SMASH!   A DARK SHAPE crashes through the window.    Glas sand and dust swirl in. Audrey and Sandra SCREAM. Charlie springs up from her hiding place, gun ready. Jeep spins around, pointing his gun, searching franticall for the intruder. It's so dark!
Where is it?!
Audrey shakes her head, tears streaming down her cheeks. looks over at her mother. Sandra's eyes are closed. It's too much.
Mom!   Open your eyes!
I can't!   I can't!
Suddenly Howard's body is TORN AWAY from Sandra. Somethin got hold of his legs!   That gets Sandra's eyes open!
(springing after her
Howard!

Howard screams deliriously as he's dragged rapidly throug the diner toward the broken front window. He flails about desperately trying to grab a hold of something. Sandra scrambles after her husband.   Reaching for him.
Daddy!

The creature reaches the window. Sandra dives for Howard' outstretched hands. She has him! The creature's progress is abruptly halted at the shatter window.   It turns back toward Sandra -- a shaft of light falling across its face, reveals: A TEENAGE GIRL of about Audrey's age.   Her skin is a dea blue. Her pupils a GHASTLY WHITE.
Deep human fingernail scratches have torn open the bloate flesh on her arms, neck and face. The self-inflicted woun of a drug addict. Her voice is not QUITE HUMAN.
See what you made me do, mother!?
Sandra screams, holds on.
No!

Charlie and Audrey rush to Sandra's side, grabbing Howard arms. Jeep is right behind them ready to fire at the creature, with the women in the way, he can't get a clear shot. So discards the gun and grabs Howard's arms. Howard screams as his body is torturously stretched.   A tug-of-war.

head_text.subj: CLAWS REACH THROUGH THE WINDOW AND GRAB HIS LEGS.

text: Howard's body lurches further out the window.
Howard!
Howard's torso is almost entirely out the window. Charlie daringly reaches for Howard's belt, desperate to gain leverage.

head_text.subj: ANOTHER DISFIGURED HAND PUNCHES THROUGH THE BLINDS AND LO

text: Charlie screams as she's yanked painfully toward the wind losing her grip on Howard's belt. Through the broken window, she sees the face of a RAGGEDY LOOKING MAN. He smiles at her like a father coming home t his baby girl.
(SWEETLY) There you are!

And he starts to pull her arm even harder...Other creatur suddenly notice her as well, focusing their attack as if alone was their target. Jeep immediately let's go of Howard and dives for Charlie grabbing her free arm just before she's pulled through.
Without the help, Audrey and Sandra can't hold on any lon Howard is ripped from of his family's hands and out the window.
Daddy!
The tide is turning. The men seem to have gotten their ga on and the dark shapes are starting to pull back.
They're running!      We got `em!
Kyle turns happily to Michael.     Gone.   Kyle looks aro roof with alarm.
Only a few more inches separate Charlie and certain death through the window. Jeep's losing her!

Charlie and Jeep fall back into the diner, the claw like hands still grasping Charlie's arm no longer attached to their owners. Michael leaps over her, a butcher's knife in one hand, a machine gun in the other. He lights up everything in his path. The window blinds become a WALL OF FIRE. Creatures SCREECH and flee into the night, having successfully take their first victim. Charlie flings the severed appendages off her and she and Jeep scoot away from the window. Hysterical, Sandra tries to push past Michael. She's goin after Howard. He intercepts her before she can make it ou
Let me go!     He's alive!
Sandra slaps at him frantically as he carries her away fr the window and thrusts her down into a back booth.
He's alive!
No...     Not anymore.
Sandra breaks down.
As Charlie climbs slowly to her feet -- a sudden pain. clutches her belly. Winces. Jeep catches her arm to steady her.
(RECOVERING) I'm okay. I'm fine.
She glances back at Michael.       He's watching her.   T
Thanks...
I told you not to do anything brave.
Charlie doesn't know how to respond.      She's about to something when -- Kyle rushes into the room.       A smile on his face.
We got `em runnin'!
Then Kyle notices the broken window, takes in the room, h excitement falling.
Where's Howard?
No one responds.   Sandra and Audrey are huddled together Crying. Bob and Percy follow Kyle in, still shaking from the adrenaline.
Someone needs to be on the roof.
I'll go.
Bob grabs Kyle's arm.
Hold on. (approaches Michael,
You better start talking.
All eyes on Michael.    These people want answers.      F
The first time God lost faith in Man he sent a flood. The second time...he sent what you see outside.
Everyone takes that in for a moment, then:
You sayin' this is the Apocalypse...?
I'm saying this is an extermination. (BEAT) Those things out there are vessels. The Possessed. The weakest willed are the easiest to turn.
Possessed by what?    Demons?
No...by angels.
That silences the room.
(pulls out his bible) Son, I don't know what bible you been readin', but in my version, the angels are the good guys.
Michael looks squarely at Percy.
That's where your book is wrong.
How come you know so much about them?
I know because until last night, I was on their side.
You mean you're...
Michael considers Jeep, then:
Not anymore...
Right and yesterday I was the fuckin' Easter Bunny. You know, fuck this. I don't even believe in God.
That's fine, because He doesn't believe in you either.
Bob stares at Michael, uncertain how to respond to that.
C'mon, Bob. Have you looked outside recently? Those aren't exactly our regular customers out there.
How do we know he didn't bring them here himself?
He brings them here and then he saves us from them? You're a genius, Bob.
Bob falls silent, confounded. Audrey hesitantly approaches Michael.
So you're here to protect us?
Not you... (looks at Charlie) Her.
Charlie reacts in shock, as all eyes are suddenly on her.
Me?!   Why me?!
Because your child is the only hope humanity has of surviving.
In response to that, Charlie does the only thing someone do when told such a thing. She LAUGHS.
No way!
But Michael isn't joking and Charlie's laughter becomes genuine fear.
(STUNNED) Jesus Christ...
Exactly.
Jeep stares at Charlie, as if suddenly his entire life is starting to make sense.
You're sayin' she's the mother of the Messiah?
Wait a minute, isn't Mary supposed to be a vi--
Go fuck yourself, Bob!
Makes you wonder about Mary.
(approaches Michael, panic setting in) Look, this is not possible! I'm just a waitress! I'm nobody! I can't give birth to the Savior of Mankind! (and finally) I don't even own a car!
None of that matters anymore. Either your child lives or Mankind dies.
So what, we're supposed to just hold those things off until Mary over there squeezes one out?
That's right.
That can't be. I'm only eight months pregnant.
Oh we're fucked.     We are so fucked!
How are we supposed to survive here for a month?
We won't have to...
At this Charlie goes white, the realization hitting her.
It's coming soon, isn't it?
Michael nods. Charlie sways on her feet.   Jeep rests a hand on her shoulder, steadying her. With a CLANK Michael re-arms his weapon, turns to the gro with finality.
If you want to live you'll do what I say. This first attack was a test of our strength. The next one will be a test of our weakness. (BEAT) Something much worse is on its way.
Everyone exchanges terrified looks.   Finally, Kyle steps forward.
Okay, what's your plan?
We'll keep watch on the roof in shifts of two. Jeep, go get some tools. We need to close up this window before somebody else goes out.
Jeep looks anxiously at Charlie, silent, scared, and then follows after Michael, leaving Charlie to stare at the SHATTERED WINDOW, the blinds flipping wildly in the wind.

Percy and Kyle keep watch, rifles at their sides. They're wrapped up from head to toe in blankets to protect them f the cold and the flies. Percy scans the horizon.   Momentary SPECTRAL FLASHES dot darkness.
They're out there. Sons of bitches. I can feel `em. (BEAT) Damn it's cold!
Percy makes the unconscious motion of rubbing his "hands" together to keep them warm. Kyle notices. Sees the dog tags.
You were in the Army?

Navy, two tours. But the second one didn't work out so well, so I didn't get to go back for a third. Suppose that makes me lucky in a way. Served with Bob, you know. That's how I ended up in this place.
What was it like?    Being in a war?
Dark.   Like this.
Kyle nods. Scared. He takes out his 45.     Nervously swi it from hand to hand.
So what's with that gun?
What?
Your piece. The one you killed grandma with. Don't reckon it's for huntin' buck.
No. I uh -- keep it for protection.
Protection from what?
From people.
Percy looks at him skeptically.
People.
Yeah, people who might try to give me a hard time, you know?
Just regular people or uh...
Yeah, well, no, not regular, regular people.
Irregular people then.
I'm talkin' people whose job it is to give other people a hard time. Kinda person who doesn't get enough fiber in their diet, you know what I'm sayin?
So it's a work thing, is it?
Exactly.    Strictly business.
This business of yours... You like it?
Kyle's eyes narrow.
Who the fuck are you to be sweatin' me, man? I got my reasons for doin' what I do.
Percy just stares at him, penetrating.     Finally:

When I was a kid my father would sit by my bed every night before I'd go to sleep and he'd say to me, Percy, if you don't wake up tomorrow, if it turns out that today was your last day on earth, would you be proud of what you've done in this life? Cuz if you ain't, then you better start gettin' square.
Kyle looks at Percy, fear in his eyes, then he turns back the darkness...and the evil that surrounds them.
rolls between dirty fingers.

Bob plays with his trusty zippo with one hand and grills some steaks with the other. He pauses in his cooking ever few moments to take a slug from a can of beer. Can't get down fast enough. Sandra sits at the counter across from him, staring at a prescription bottle tipped in front of her, pills spread around. Bob glances over, sees the devastation in her eyes. He pu another can of beer from underneath the counter, pops it places it in front of her.
On the house.
She looks up at him.    Smiles weakly.   Takes a sip.
Thanks.
You hungry?
Couldn't eat if my life depended on it.
Well I figure just cuz the world's coming to an end, it doesn't mean a man's gotta starve. All I can say is thank heavens they left the gas on.
Sandra takes another sip of beer.   Considers it.
Never much cared for beer. Howard's the beer drinker in the family.
The moment the words leave her mouth, the grief hits her again. She gathers up some pills from the counter, tosses them back and downs her beer like there's no tomorrow. Th is a battle she's losing.

Meanwhile in a booth across the diner, Audrey is fiddling with Percy's old radio. Back and forth on the dial. Listening for anything. Nothing but STATIC. Up at the front of the diner, Jeep silently helps Michael nail broken table planks across the shattered window. He eyes the strange tatoos running down Michael's arms, the jagged wounds visible above his shirt line.
What did you do...you know, before you came here...?
Michael considers the question a beat, then:
I was a soldier, a general, in His army.
Well, what changed?   What made you leave?
I was given an order I didn't believe in... (off Jeep's look:) He lost faith. I hadn't.
Michael drives the last nail into place, securing the win
So what happens to you...after this is over?
Michael pauses a beat, as if unsure how much to say, then
Sometimes we have to face the thing we fear the most in order to be free of it.
Michael picks up his gun.
It's almost time for the next shift.
Michael heads for the roof, leaving Jeep to stare after h deep in thought.
The faintest glint of sunlight through the dark red dusty haze. A new day has forced itself into existence. TITLE:   "December 24th - 6:05am"

Michael is searching the horizon in front of the diner fo movement. His expression focused, determined. On the other side of the roof, Bob keeps watch, strugglin stay awake. The beer taking over. His eyes droop closed.
Sandra awakens with a start.
Howard?
But Howard's not there. And everyone else in the diner is still asleep. The drugs have started to wear off... and h fear is returning.
Sandra splashes water on her face.   Stares at herself in mirror. A living wreck.
Sandra steps out of the bathroom.
(a whisper) Sandra...
Sandra freezes.
Who's there?
A beat then:
Sandra...
Sandra spins around.    Searching.
Howard?     Is that you?
It sure sounded like Howard.
Help me...     Please...
This time, it's clear where the voice is coming from. turns to face the BACK DOOR. A desk blocks it. Sandra ever so slowly approaches the door.
(from behind the door) Help me. Sandra...
Sandra is stricken.    What the hell is she going to do? That's when Sandra notices the TRANSOM WINDOW above the d She climbs onto the desk and stretches up until she can s out.

Howard. Her husband. Ten feet away from the door.     NAI TO AN UPSIDE-DOWN CROSS. But wait. It gets worse. His skin is covered with horribl black boils. And even worse than that. Howard's boils are breathing. Sandra goes slack with horror.
Help me, please!
Howard's torn open shirt reveals the BREATHING PUSTULES covering his body. He writhes in slow, excruciating agony
Howard!
Sandra scrambles down off the desk and frantically pushes away from the door. She's reaching for the dead bolt when Audrey and Kyle appear in the doorway.
Mom!
Kyle races to restrain Sandra.
Let me go!     He's alive!
She struggles against him, throwing a wild elbow that tag Kyle in the face. Down he goes. Sandra is about to open the door when Audrey pounces on h
The SHOUTING from the back office awakens the rest of the sleepers. Percy springs up. Charlie is shaking Jeep.
The ROAR OF WIND ripping off the plain is all that can be heard. ON BOB as his head drops down with drunken fatigue Sleep. RISING OVER HIM TO SEE... Howard nailed to the upside-down cross below.

Sandra and Audrey are locked in battle. Sandra slaps Audr hard. Audrey stumbles over Kyle and hits the floor. Percy appears in the doorway. Now is her last chance. Sandra whips open the back door a that's when the world hits SLOW MOTION. Howard is there.    A few feet away.   Alive. Sandra races toward him.    Just behind her comes Percy.
Howard!

And that's when the speed ACCELERATES TO NORMAL -- -- and the boils covering Howard's body explode -- sprayi streams of dark fluid toward Sandra -- -- just at the moment Percy spins around her, shielding h from the spray, which hits him in the back. But he's not stopping. Percy pushes Sandra back into the diner, the do SLAMMING closed behind them. Percy releases Sandra, letting her stumble hysterically i the room. Kyle and Jeep grab her, forcing her to the grou But she's not fighting anymore. Charlie turns to look at Percy who is still standing with back to the door, breathing heavily.
Percy?
He takes a step forward, then falls to ground. The entire back side of his body is gone.      Burned awa
covering a body.

Percy's body lies covered on the table. Bob stares rueful at his dead friend. A broken man. Tears stream down his face. He rolls the Zippo between his fingers. Jeep watches his father from the doorway.
We should get back out there...
Just gimme another minute with him, okay?
Jeep nods, quietly leaves his father at the side of his d friend.
Catatonic.

Michael and Bob are tying Sandra to a chair. Not like it looks like she's capable of going anywhere, but you never know. Across the diner, Charlie eyes Michael cautiously. Michae never goes for more than a few moments without looking up her. It's not lecherous. More like a protective father making sure his child hasn't strayed too far. In a booth, Audrey watches, red-eyed, as Michael restrain her mother. Then she returns her attention to Percy's rad Tuning. Trying to find something, anything in the STATIC.
She brings her ear up close.      Wait.   Is that a VOICE She adjusts the antenna, trying to bring the signal into focus. CLEARER.
Hey...
CLEARER.   Yes.   It's a VOICE!
Hey! You guys, I think I got something here!
Everyone drops what they're doing and quickly gathers aro the radio. THROUGH THE HAZE OF STATIC, A GRAVELY, TIRED VOICE. BEYOND BELIEF. BUT STILL BROADCASTING.
... battling has been fierce. The numbers of casualties are unknown but all indications are that they must be unimaginably large.

If you're just joining us, we're getting some of the first bits of good news, if you can call it that, since this apocalypse began just twenty-four ago. A human militia has formed on the outskirts of Las Vegas and has begun to engage the enemy. Also down in the Four Corners area, we've been receiving unconfirmed reports of another resistance force gathering in Red Rock National in the northern Mojave Desert area.
Red Rock...
That can't be more than an hour up the highway from here.
Does that mean we can leave?
No.    We're not going anywhere.
What the hell are you talkin' about? This is our chance!
We can't risk being on the move when the child comes. It's too dangerous.
Bob looks over at Charlie, defeated. She shakes her head, anger building. She sweeps some plates off the counter an races for the bathroom.
... And as we fight this new enemy, may God give us the strength to survive and show mercy for those of us who are already lost...
being lit.

Charlie stands at the sink, cigarette to her lips, water running, stealing a private moment. She takes a deep drag feels the smoke filling her lungs, defiant. Then she catches a look at herself in the mirror, runs he hand along the curvature of her belly. Tears well up in h eyes, fear and anger overtaking her. She stamps out the cigarette in a fit of frustration.
It's quiet. DRIFTING past sleeping figures to find Charli wide-awake, sitting at a booth, lost in thought.
Guess it's your turn not to sleep.
Charlie looks up to see Jeep sit down across from her.
Hey...
Jeep sees the strain on her face.
You okay?
You mean besides the fact that I just found out that I'm the mother of the Messiah?
Jeep smiles, nods.

Crazy thing is...I didn't want this baby. I even went down to the clinic, you know that? (off Jeep's reaction:) I remember sitting there in the waiting room, absolutely sure I was doin' the right thing...And that's when the feeling started. Like I was falling into the deepest, darkest hole imaginable. I couldn't breathe, I couldn't speak. I kept thinking this must be what death is like. And when finally they called my name, I ran. (BEAT) For a while after that I tried pretending that it was just cold feet, that I could go back if I wanted to, that I could decide to end it like I'd planned. Then I'd start to have that feeling again and I knew I didn't have a choice. Somehow this had already been decided. And it made me hate this thing that's been growing inside me.
A long beat, as Jeep considers her, then:
You shouldn't say things like that, Charlie. It isn't right. You'll get through this. I know you will.
She turns to him, the bitterness overtaking her:
How come you have so much faith in me, Jeep? God knows I've never given you or anybody else a reason to. Or is it that you just can't find any other hard-luck case to follow around?
Jeep's face hardens.   He gets up.   Hurt.   Frustrated.
You know, you're not the only who's suffered, okay? Let me know when you stop feeling sorry for yourself.
And with that, Jeep walks away, leaving Charlie to stare after him, disturbed and surprised by his response.
Sand and wind.    The INVISIBLE SUN is sinking. Kyle and Audrey are bundled together on the roof, keeping watch. Kyle is showing her how to hold the MP5.
...Then you just flip this --
Audrey flips the safety.
Yeah, I got it. All the way down. Two clicks.
She points the gun out into the haze like she's been hold one all her life. Off Kyle's surprised look:
Dated this guy last summer. A marine. Had a thing for guns. Parents hated him.
I bet they did.

After a moment, Audrey switches the safety back on.   Han the gun over to Kyle. Audrey stares into the red nothingness surrounding them. expression growing distant. She seems to have aged years overnight.
My parents hate everything I do. That's why we were moving.
Yeah?

They thought a more "wholesome" environment would help me "change my ways." So fucked up. Only reason they care at all is cuz they don't want to be embarrassed in front of their friends at the country club.
Kyle considers her thoughtfully.
The only time my old man ever paid attention to me was when I was doing somethin' bad. So you know what I did?
What?
I got really good at being bad.

She smiles at this confession.    Can obviously relate. wipes a tear from her cheek. She leans in.   Kisses him.   Passionately.   Desperately His hands trace over her body. She claws at him. Her passion growing out of control. She's practically devouring him. Kyle can barely keep up. It's like something else beyond sensual need has taken ov She moves down his chest.     Further.   Kyle leans his h back. Further. Just then the SPOT LIGHTS that illuminate the roof sign c to life.   The young couple stops to look up at the brill red word "Paradise" illuminated above them. Down below, the gas pumps LIGHT UP.      The station's FLUORESCENTS flicker on.

All at once the entire diner COMES BACK TO LIFE. The jukebox WHIRS ON, filling the room with Merle Haggard "I'm a Lonesome Fugitive". Bob's TV glows with bright rolling STATIC. The electric fan spins on above the grill.
Jeep and Michael move to look through the slats at the window. Charlie is giving Sandra some water through a straw. Bob wanders in, squinting at the sudden presence of light
We back in business?
I don't think so.
The truck stop is lit up like a Christmas tree. If you didn't know better, you might mistake the place for busin as usual. Kyle and Audrey stand on the roof, taking in th dramatic change.
Is it over?
I don't know.
HEADLIGHTS appear on the highway.
(raising his gun) You better get downstairs.
No, I can handle it.
Kyle stares at Audrey's beautiful, determined face.    Th pulls out his silver 45.
(handing her the gun) Just in case.
The headlights become a FAMILY MINIVAN careening wildly o the highway to stop at the pumps.
Get ready.

They aim their weapons at the vehicle. A well dressed MAN in his mid-thirties jumps out of the c He looks around nervously, scared. Then, seeing that the coast is clear, he offers a calming wave to his WIFE and YOUNG BOY who wait anxiously for him inside the car.
He races around to the gas pump.
(lowering his gun) Wait a minute.
Kyle, are they...

A distant SCREECH from behind. Kyle and Audrey spin to lo out over the back side of the diner. AN ARMY OF DARK SHAPES are swarming in fast. Kyle looks urgently back at the family.    The father lif pump. Flips the lever.
It's a trap. They saw them coming and turned on the lights. It's a fucking trap!
Kyle and Audrey wave their arms frantically at the family
Hey! Get back in your car!      It's a trap!

But down below, the man can only hear the sound of RAGING WIND as he pumps the gas. Kyle fires his gun in the air.   BLAM!   BLAM!     BLAM! At the sound of gunfire, the man looks quickly up to the roof.   His family heard it too and they start to SCREAM HIM. The man can only see silhouettes in this light, but he's not waiting around to see if it's friend or foe. Audrey watches in horror as the dark shapes reach the din
They're not gonna make it.

The father dashes to the driver's side.    He throws open door. But he's too late. He looks over his shoulder just in tim to see a BLUR OF MOVEMENT RUSHING AT HIM. His BLOOD PAINTS the car windows. Kyle raises his MP5 to fire upon the dark shapes that surround the vehicle like swarming insects. The wife and boy scream hysterically as they are torn fro the vehicle by skeletal hands.
(pushing his barrel down) Wait! You'll hit them too!
So Kyle makes a desperately courageous play. He leaps ont the roof's sloped overhang -- sliding fast -- he drops to ground in front of the diner.
Kyle!
Kyle charges the dark mob. Creatures peel away from the woman and boy to confront Kyle head-on. He lets loose with a rain of bullets, eviscerating everyt that comes at him.
The group gathered at the window sees Kyle racing out tow the pumps.
Jesus Christ, what the hell is that boy doin'!
We have to get `im back in here!
Bob springs into action.   Pushes the booth away from the front door. The sound of a gun COCKING. Bob looks over to see Michael pointing a gun at his head.
Don't. You open that door and we could all be dead.

The Possessed move in from all sides, but Kyle is remarka agile, dropping one after another in a stunning display. He closes in on the family, blasting back the creatures huddled around them. He finds the YOUNG BOY curled up with his hands protectiv covering his face. Kyle swoops down and gathers the boy into his arms.
I got you!

Kyle moves on to the mother. But something odd is happeni The creatures have stopped coming at him. In fact, they're just standing there watching him.   Wait Kyle freezes.   CLOSE ON HIM as he senses something terri wrong.
Mister...
Kyle looks over at the boy in his arms.   GHOSTLY WHITE E stare back at him.
(WHISPERS) Fooled ya.

head_text.subj: A FLASH OF TEETH AS KYLE'S THROAT IS TORN OUT.

text: Kyle drops to his knees. Up on the roof, Audrey watches helplessly as Kyle falls.
Kyle!
Bob kicks over a table in disgust.
Damn it all to hell!
Oh, no.   Audrey...
Out the window they see Audrey drop down from the roof an run towards Kyle.
The young boy stands over Kyle, silently watching the lif drain from his body. The boy looks up to see Audrey approaching fast. Tears suddenly appear in his eyes. He opens his arms pleadingly her.
I'm sorry!     I didn't mean to!
Fuck you!
Audrey raises the 45 and ...     CLICK.   CLICK.   CLICK. She keeps pulling the trigger.    Nothing. The boy's tears stop instantly. He looks at her with an eerie calm for someone so young.
You're gonna die now.

The boy moves toward Audrey, stepping over Kyle's body. Audrey backs away. She looks toward the entrance to the diner. Blocked by advancing creatures. They're everywhere.    She's trapped. She notices the open door to the MINIVAN.     And so she Audrey dives into the car as the throng of creatures rapi closes in. She hammers the auto door lock. CLUNK! She moves to the center of the car as gruesome faces pres against the windows. A nightmare come to life.
Panic. Charlie rushes to Michael's side.
Do you have no heart?!     She's just a kid!
But he's immovable.
You can't let her die! (grabbing a gun from the
I swear if you don't do something, I will!
Charlie COCKS the gun, moves toward the door.
Wait.
Charlie looks back at him, defiant.   No one breathes.
(raising his guns) Open the door.
Bob springs into action, clearing the door and flipping t dead bolt. The door is opened and Michael charges passed Charlie and out into hell.

With stunning calm, Michael marches straight for the pump IN THE MINIVAN, Audrey screams as the windows begin to CR She's running out of time. Michael grabs a gas pump, flips the lever and points it a the minivan. What's he up to? The creatures covering the car turn to look at Michael as they've just now noticed him. And that's when he starts spraying gas at them. But wait, there's more to this trick. Up comes Michael's Glock in h other hand and BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! The spray of gas EXPLODES into a SPRAY OF FIRE! The MINIVAN is engulfed in flames. Creatures tear away from the car like fiery comets throug the night. The windows EXPLODE, showering Audrey with tiny shards of glass. Michael drops the gas pump. He reaches through a fire rimmed broken car window and unlocks the door. Audrey looks up to see Michael's expressionless face CIRC BY A RING OF FIRE.
Come with me.
Meanwhile, fire is spreading quickly under the car... Michael pulls Audrey from the flaming vehicle.
Run.
And together they run toward the open diner door.

head_text.subj: BEHIND THEM THE MINIVAN EXPLODES. A BALL OF FIRE ROARS

text: Everyone's eyes go wide at the insanity they're witnessin Audrey is the first one in. Michael is almost there.   But the fire is faster, ENGULF
Michael!
(pulling Charlie away from the door) Get back!

BURSTING OUT OF THE FLAMES, Michael marches confidently i the diner. Jeep slams the door CLOSED just as the WALL OF FIRE REACHES THEM. Everyone hits the deck as the FIRE SHOOTS THROUGH THE SLA covering the windows like spindly fingers reaching for pr Michael's clothes are a smoky, smoldering mess.   Jeep an rush to pat him down. Audrey's coughing from the smoke.
I'll get some water!

Charlie dashes behind the counter to the sink.    She fil a pitcher of water. She turns away from the sink with the filled pitcher... And SCREAMS! The YOUNG BOY with the lifeless white eyes stands before wielding an ENORMOUS BUTCHER'S KNIFE. The pitcher shatters LOUDLY on the floor. The boy swings the knife at her, slicing open the waitres outfit covering her pregnant belly. Charlie tumbles back to the ground behind the counter. Sh frantically pushes herself away from the approaching boy.
But she doesn't have far to go before she'll run out of r to maneuver.
C'mon, don't be scared. I just wanna play with your baby.

That's it.    She's backed against the end of the counter The boy raises the knife to strike. Charlie grabs a baking pan off a shelf. Swings it out in front of her body like a shield, as the KNIFE IS DRIVEN D CLANG! The knife hits the pan hard and stops. But the boy hands don't. They slip off the handle and run right down blade. The knife CLATTERS to the ground. The boy instinctively raises his hands to strike again, b there's no knife. Charlie watches in horror as the boy calmly realizes that THUMBS ARE MISSING. Blood sprays from the stumps. Charlie pulls her legs in close then rockets them out at boy's chest. He's catapulted away from her. Michael leaps over the counter, landing in front of Charl guns ready for action. But the boy is gone.
Are you hurt?
Charlie shakes her head no.
Where is he?!
That's when the electricity goes out once again, PLUNGING DINER BACK INTO DARKNESS.
He's still in here!
FLASHLIGHT BEAMS fan out across the diner. LIGHTING under chairs.    Under tables.
Where the fuck is he?!
A SCAMPERING SOUND... MOVING FAST.    Everybody spins to the location of the sound.
As soon as they move in one direction, the SCAMPERING is heard in another. Jeep's LIGHT CATCHES SOMETHING ON THE GROUND.      A TRAI BLOOD.
He's bleeding!

head_text.subj: BLOOD ACROSS THE DINER WHERE IT ENDS AT...

text: Jeep raises his LIGHT UP THE WALL WHERE THE TRAIL OF BLOO REACHES THE CEILING AND...STOPS.
What the fuck?
Bob flails around trying to pull the boy's small, but dea strong arms away from his neck.
Dad!
Jeep can't get a clear shot.       Bob's gasping for air. Michael grabs the boy and fiercely rips him off of Bob's back. He swings the boy around like a living shot put.
Get ready!

Jeep and Bob whip up their guns as Michael throws the wic creature into the air. Sandra's vacant face flickers in the light as the SOUND O GUNFIRE AND INHUMAN SCREAMING fill the diner. And then in moments...      All is QUIET. BEHIND THE COUNTER, Audrey helps Charlie to her feet. WINCES. Doubles over, clutching her stomach.
Oh, no!
Michael lowers his flashlight.      CLEAR FLUID runs down Charlie's legs.
Inky darkness.   A flickering light emanates from within diner. TITLE:   "December 25th - 3:33am" The sound of CHARLIE'S SCREAM, carries us to:
Charlie, drenched in sweat is writhing on the ground with Michael holding down her arms and Audrey kneeling between legs. Pots of steaming water surround them.
What am I supposed to do? Just `cause I'm a girl doesn't mean I automatically know how to do this!
Just do as I say.
Yeah, but, how do you know how to do this?!
Bob and Jeep keep watch. The SPECTRAL LIGHTS in the distance seem to be growing la -- closer. Charlie's SCREAMING rises up from below.
What a way to bring a child into the world. (looks over at Jeep) She ever tell you his name?
She's never said. I just assumed it was Joe Danvers. You know how she's always had a thing for bad boys.
Bob hears the spite in Jeep's voice.
Jeep, sooner or later she'll realize you're the best thing that's ever happened to her.
I thought you said I should move on?
Can't a father be wrong sometimes?
Jeep considers Bob with a smile, then comes the sound... A DEEP, LONG, BODY RUMBLING TONE rising up off the plain, if emanating from the largest HORN ever constructed.
What was that...?
The SPECTRAL LIGHTS dot the landscape now with untold numbers.
Michael reacts to the sound. An urgency comes over him. Audrey arrives with more steaming water.
What is that?!
He's coming. We have to hurry.
Who's coming? Whaddya mean hurry? This isn't something you can exactly hurry, is it?
Charlie, I need you to push. I need you to push as hard as you can.
Michael, who's coming?!
Charlie pushes, tears streaming down her face, delirious pain. It's a gruesome, bloody affair. It's getting close.
We're almost there...
Jeep and Bob watch helplessly as the ARMY OF CREATURES ha closed within a hundred yards of the diner. Their ranks stretch back seemingly without end into the darkness.
We're not gonna make it outta here, are we?
Bob looks at his son.   The agony stretched across his fa
I'm sorry Jeep. This shouldn't be happening to you...
Jeep rests a comforting hand on his father's shoulder. Bo pulls his son close and hugs him with all his might, tear filling his eyes.
Amidst the dirt and darkness, Charlie lets out a final agonizing SCREAM... ...and then comes a BABY'S CRIES.   Audrey, eyes wide, ho up the CHILD. Stunned. Elated.
Oh my god...we did it!    Charlie, you did it!

Audrey places the child in Charlie's arms. She stares at baby, holding it at a distance, unsure of whether to embr it or be terrified by it. A commitment she's not yet read to make, even at this late hour.
(CONFUSED) It's okay. The baby's okay.
Charlie looks to Audrey, tears streaming down her face.
I don't...I...
Audrey looks to Michael, unsure.
Take him... Give her a minute.
Audrey nods, takes the baby back from Charlie, tries to soothe him by pacing around the diner.
It's okay...It's okay...Shhh...

Another DRONE OF THE HORN RATTLES THE WALLS.      Menacin Closer. Audrey   reacts, crosses to the counter, turns on the rad trying   to drown out the sound of the approaching menace of the   STATIC, the haunting sounds of BING CROSBY singi SILENT   NIGHT fills the room. The quiet before the storm Michael helps Charlie quickly clean herself up.     She s at him, a burning spite in her eyes.
So are we safe now?   Is it over?
No. Killing the child would have ended the war before it had begun. Now, at least, he will have a chance to grow up, a chance to lead the world out of darkness.
Those words provide her little comfort.
And what happens until then...?
You'll need to teach him how.
Charlie shakes her head, this is all too much.
What makes you think I can do that? What makes you think I want to do that? If he's so important, why don't you take him?
Each of us has a burden. This one is yours and yours alone. Maybe someday you'll understand what that means.

Off Charlie's look, we move across the diner where Audrey approaches her mother, kneels down in front of her. Despi how much her mother pisses her off, it breaks her heart t see her in such a demoralized state.
Mama? Can you hear me? (holds up the baby) We did it...The baby's alive.
AUDREY (cont'd) (BEAT) Mama?

If Sandra hears her daughter, it doesn't show in her face Tears well up in Audrey's eyes as she moves away from her mother. But we HOLD here and... DRIFT DOWN BEHIND THE CHAIR TO REVEAL Sandra's hands are loosening the bonds. BLOOD TRICKLES from where the rope's cut through her skin.
DRIFTING THROUGH the dark shapes as the BABY'S CRIES reverberate up and down the ranks. They begin to look abo frantically, agitated by the sound. Some even begin to ba away from the diner.

Off in the distance, the diner is but a dim flickering li above the plain. It could almost be mistaken for a stable a desert town a long time ago. THREE STARS burn bright and low in the black sky. All around us the DARK CREATURES are cowering from sound the CRYING INFANT whose wails seem to grow even LOUDER th further away from the diner we get.
In the darkness below we see the lights of the legions of creatures dot the landscape and at the center of it all, truck stop. The sound of WINGS BEATING AGAINST THE WIND.

head_text.subj: AND WE'RE DRIFTING DOWN TOWARD THE DINER ENTRANCE. LIKE

text: Jeep and Bob enter the diner to see Michael helping Charl to her feet, while Audrey continues to pace, the bundle o bloody blankets cradled in her arms.
Something's happening.    They're moving away.
The Possessed can't come near the child, so He sent someone that can. Someone like me.
Who?
Gabriel. My lieutenant.      He's come to do what I wouldn't.
ON JEEP as the realization hits him.
Your orders...
Michael looks at Jeep.
You were the one who was supposed to kill the baby? That was the order you didn't obey.
Michael nods grimly.    Charlie looks urgently at Michael
What's he talking about?
The baby CRIES LOUDER.
Michael, what the hell's he talking about?!
There was never meant to be a Second Coming. But we've just changed that. The child lives. The future is unwritten. There's still hope.
Charlie, shaken by this revelation, reaches out to Audrey
Audrey...?
Audrey moves to hand over the baby to Charlie...

head_text.subj: ...AND THAT'S WHEN SANDRA SPRINGS OUT OF HER CHAIR AND
SNATCHES THE BABY FROM AUDREY'S ARMS

text: Sandra backs away from them, moving toward the front door Hers is the face of madness.
Stay away from me!    Don't come any closer!
Mom!
Don't do it, lady!
You heard what he said. They just want the baby. Maybe if we just give it to them, then they'll let us go!
Michael cocks his gun.   Points it at Sandra.

head_text.subj: THE HORN BLARES ONCE MORE, DEAFENING, SHAKING EVERYTHING
THE DINER. IT'S RIGHT OUTSIDE THE DOOR.

text: Charlie squares off with Sandra, panic in her eyes.
Give him to me!
Why?! You never wanted him in the first place!
Charlie stares at her in horror, the truth of those words rattling her to the very core.
Sandra is almost to the front door.
It's just one baby.   Just one.

A brilliant SPECTRAL LIGHT pours into the diner. Sandra is blinded.   She raises a hand to block the light And that's when Michael fires.    BLAM! Sandra staggers back, blood dripping from the hole in her forehead, and...

head_text.subj: ...THE BABY GOES FLYING OUT OF HER HANDS

text: Charlie screams and the WORLD MOVES INTO SLOW MOTION... everything suddenly goes very QUIET.

Michael fires again.   Blowing Sandra's body back through doorway. Jeep watches the baby sail SLOWLY through the air. The time for Jeep to act is now! Jeep DIVES for the baby...catching the bundle of rags mer inches from the ground! And then he looks up to see... The dark SILHOUETTE OF A MAN approaching from out of the spectral light. A MAN WITH WINGS. Jeep's eyes grow wide as the FIERCE ANGEL steps into the diner. But this looks like no angel we've seen before. This is a creature built for war. Rough hewn, battle scarred. His body armor making him appear disturbingly insect like. His wings are not feathery or gentle. Rather they are hard, mechanical, an organic machine. The angel's wings retract with clockwork-like precision. And now that we see the his face clearly, we notice his striking resemblance to Michael. We might even mistake th for brothers. His name is GABRIEL. Gabriel raises a massive, ferocious, strangely mechanical looking MACE in his powerful hands. And the world returns to NORMAL SPEED as Gabriel brings t mace arcing down at Jeep. Jeep rolls! CLANG! The weapon just misses him, hitting th floor in a spray of sparks, literally CRACKING THE GROUND Gabriel brings the mace up again.   Jeep won't be so luck twice.
Sonuvabitch!

Bob charges at the creature, sub-machine gun blazing. Gabriel reacts by instantly UNFOLDING HIS WINGS and launc himself into the air. The bullets clawing up the wall beh him. But Bob's heroic move has given Jeep time to get up and r with the baby for the back of the diner. He thrusts the child into Charlie's hands. And without even thinking, sh pulls the child protectively to her chest.

Gabriel drops down in front of Bob, whipping his wings ar like a deadly, RAZOR SHARP FAN! Bob stops firing, a look of surprise stretches over his f His gun falling from his hands. Blood begins to pour out of the slice across his belly.
No!
With a sweep of his hand, Gabriel sends Bob flying across diner where he crashes down behind the counter near the stove. Michael GRABS JEEP'S HAND before the boy can rush back in the fray.
No, Jeep! You must protect the child now!
Me?!   What about you?
My path ends here. You are the true protector. You always have been.
Jeep shakes his head, panic setting in.
But I don't know what to do!
Find the Prophets.   Learn to read the instructions.
Michael lets go of Jeep's hand and turns away to face Gabriel, leaving Jeep to contemplate those final words.
Prophets? What Prophets?   What instructions?!

And that's when Jeep opens his hand to find the KEYS to Michael's Police Cruiser. Jeep looks up from the keys to see Charlie, Audrey and th baby. The responsibility crashing in on him. Then he clos his hand around the keys, determination building.
C'mon!
Charlie looks past Jeep to see Michael returning to the f
Wait!     We can't leave him!
We have no choice!    We have to get to Red Rock!

He pulls Charlie past the counter toward the back office. Jeep stops when he sees his father's broken body lying on ground by the stove in a pool of his own blood. Bob's half open eyes focus on his son. In his outstretche hand is that goddamn ZIPPO LIGHTER... and next to that, a BROKEN GAS PIPE leading to the stove. Jeep is terrified.
Dad!
Jeep tries to help him up.
Leave me, Jeep.     My place is here, remember?
But Dad...!
Bob smiles weakly at his son and says simply:
Run.
And so Jeep, fighting back tears, does what his father sa
Audrey and Jeep push the desk away from the door. Charlie opens it.    Sand swirls in around her. And Jeep leads the trio out the door.
Michael and Gabriel square off in the diner, not like enemies, but like brothers on opposite sides of a terribl family conflict.
I knew he'd send you, Gabriel. You were always so eager to please Him.
Unlike you...the rebellious son. (noticing Michael's scars) Pity about your wings. They would have helped you now.
To not feel their burden...is a dream.
You think you can defy Him and not pay the price?
The child lives. What happens to me doesn't matter now.
Yours is a fool's sacrifice. You can help them sneak out the back door, but they won't escape. (BEAT) And neither will you, brother.
Michael slowly approaches Gabriel.
(SOFT) I'm not running anymore.
Gabriel hesitates, doubt clouding his face.    This was n what he was expecting.
(SENSING) Join with me. You don't need do this. There's another way.
A beat, then Gabriel's expression hardens.
There is no other way...
He pulls back from Michael, raising the mace -- SCHING! - LONG DEADLY SHARP SPIKES BURSTS FROM ALL ITS SIDES...as i wasn't bad-ass enough. And the fight begins.

It's mace against machine gun and strangely enough, it se under Gabriel's deft control, the mace is the vastly supe weapon. With the aid of his wings, Gabriel moves with staggering speed, defying gravity to avoid the rain of bullets. The place is getting absolutely shot to hell. Michael leaps from table top to table top as Gabriel brin the mace brutally down -- splintering everything it touch Michael leaps onto the last unbroken table top -- spins t fire. Gabriel pushes into the air, jabbing a spike straig into the barrel of Michael's MP5. The gun explodes in Michael's hands, sending him rocketing backwards where he lands on the counter. Gabriel swoops in fast. Michael kicks him in the chest, sending him fluttering back. Michael thrusts himself to his feet.   Gabriel recovers, again. Michael grabs a hold of Bob's ceiling mounted TV for supp and lifts his body just above the deadly spike. Michael kicks Gabriel in the head, momentarily stunning h Michael dives at Gabriel, landing an awesome flurry of punches. Gabriel is rattled back by the assault.   He clumsily lif his mace and thrusts with it. Michael narrowly evades the razor point, which drives int wall. Michael smashes down on Gabriel's wrist, CRACKING the bon A swift kick to the chest and Gabriel is thrust crashing back, losing his grip on the weapon. Michael takes a running leap onto Gabriel's back. Gabriel launches wildly into the air, trying to throw Mic off. They hit the ceiling, but Michael hangs on. Choking the life out of Gabriel.

Audrey and Jeep help Charlie quickly move around the side the diner where the cruiser is parked. They are buffeted winds and sand. Jeep puts Charlie and the baby into the front passenger s while Audrey hustles in back.
Jeep rounds to the driver's side.     Hops in.
Jeep frantically tries to get the right key into the ignition. It's in. Jeep turns the key but the ENGINE STRUGGLES TO FIRE UP. Panic.
Come on, Jeep!
I'm trying!

Jeep gives it some gas, but the ENGINE'S NOT CATCHING. A DARK SHAPE POUNCES ONTO THE HOOD OF THE CAR. The light catches it, revealing the disfigured face and beard of a SHOPPING MALL SANTA CLAUS, his oversized belly gruesomely distended. Charlie screams.
Fuck!
Jeep pumps the gas and the ENGINE BURSTS TO LIFE! The creature's about to punch a fist through the glass
(throwing the car in
Hang on!
Jeep floors it, causing the cruiser to rocket backwards toward the highway.

Jeep pulls the wheel hard and the cruiser whips around a 180 onto the road. THE CREATURE SHOOTS OFF THE CAR AND HITS THE ASPHALT. Jeep throws it in drive just as the POSSESSED SANTA rises from the pavement. Pedal to the metal.

The creature doesn't have a chance as the cruiser PLOWS i him. BONES CRUNCH as a flash of red and white is sent sailing the car and tumbling down onto the road behind them in a cloud of dust. Jeep clenches the wheel, pedal to the floor.
Okay, we need to figure out our weapon situation.   Hopefully Michael didn't take everything out of the car.
Jeep places his Glock on the dash. He sees that he's got police issue shotgun in the front seat rack. Charlie searches under her seat.   Pulls out a...GRENADE.
Is this what I think it is?
Yes. Now just put it down... Slowly.
Charlie places it onto the seat. Audrey fishes around in the backseat.
(holding up each item) Okay, all I got is a flare gun thing. Looks like we got a box of flares to go with it.
Okay. Okay. Handgun. Shotgun. A a flare gun... And a grenade. Alright. (hands Charlie the Glock) Load this. (BEAT) Audrey, can you figure out how to load that flare gun without killing us all?
I can try.
Try real hard, okay?
Audrey anxiously sets about loading the flare gun.

Gabriel flies into a wall in an attempt to crush Michael. fails that but succeeds in leaving a massive dent. Gabriel runs/flies for the opposite wall. This one doesn' hold and the two enemies crash through it into the bathro Unbelievably Michael is still holding on. Gabriel is up. He thrusts himself back into the bathroom mirror. It shatters painfully behind Michael. Gabriel rages out of the bathroom and into the diner. Michael continues to ride him like a wild bull. Gabriel slams Michael into a wall once more.   It's a bru struggle. Gabriel spots his mace sticking out of the wall within ar reach. He grabs it, holding it futilely in front of him. From th angle he'd never be able to hit Michael with it. Gabriel' strength is giving way. Michael is winning. Gabriel lets out a tremendous ROAR and plunges one of the mace's long spikes into his own stomach. Michael's eyes g wide with surprise, his grip loosens. Gabriel has run the both through. Gabriel rips the mace from his body and stumbles forward. Blood pours from a huge hole in Michael's chest.   Right through his heart. Gabriel looks down at the hole in his own belly. Not near as bad as Michael's. Apparently there's not a lot of bloo left in this guy. Michael falls to his knees.   Weakening. Gabriel looms over Michael.   Michael looks up at him, bl leaking from his mouth.
You always wanted to live like one of them...Now you'll know how it feels to die like one of them.
Gabriel raises the mighty mace above his head. Michael closes his eyes.   Submitting. The mace comes swinging down...

The cruiser hits the FLY STORM. Black. Nothing is visible beyond the windows. BUZZING surrounds them. DEAFENING. Jeep turns on the windshield wipers.     Hits the brights PING!   PING!   PING!   Driving blind! ON THE SPEEDOMETER as their speed slows to a crawl.
Go faster!
I can't fuckin' see!
Charlie's desperately trying to soothe her SCREAMING baby ON THE AIR VENTS as FLIES start crawling in.
Oh, no.
Gabriel is looking down upon Michael's broken body. Something is happening to his skin. The DARK WRITING THAT COVERS HIS BODY is beginning UN-WRITE itself and DISAPPEA

Charlie is struggling to close the air vents to stop the inflow of BUZZING insects. It's not working! She looks to Jeep in desperation, but something more frightening catches her attention. The INTRICATE WRITING is beginning to appear on Jeep's ar snaking its way up from his wrists like VINES.
Jeep, your arm!
Jeep sees it, eyes go wide.
What is it?
A beat, as Jeep remembers Michael's parting words...
The instructions...

Gabriel watches as the last of the writing FADES from Michael's body when he hears a faint CLICKING sound from somewhere in the diner. Gabriel moves gracefully through the destroyed diner, tow the source of the CLICKING. He steps behind the counter and finds Bob lying in a mass pool of blood. It takes the creature a moment to realize that the CLICKI sound is coming from Bob's SILVER ZIPPO. Bob is focusing every last ounce of life in his body to lighting that lighter. CLICK... CLICK... CLICK... Bob looks at Gabriel.
Sorry...   We're closed.

And with one last brush of his thumb, Bob's trusty ZIPPO IGNITES. Gabriel's eyes go wide as the TINY FLAME DANCES in front the stove's broken gas line. Gabriel spins and runs like hell as the gas explodes.

head_text.subj: A STREAM OF FIRE ENGULFS HIM AS HIS WINGS UNFOLD AND HE L

text: The MASSIVE EXPLOSION rocks the slow moving vehicle. In the rearview mirror, Jeep sees the CLOUD OF FIRE MUSHROOMING UP in the sky behind them. It's eerily magnificent.
The swarm, it's fading!
Jeep looks back to the road as, sure enough, the FLY SWAR suddenly dissipates all around them, revealing a CLEAR VI of the highway ahead. Jeep knows at what price this good fortune has come.
Thank you...

head_text.subj: AND THAT'S WHEN THE WORD "PARADISE" CRASHES DOWN LIKE A B
OF FIRE ONTO THE ROAD DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF THEM

text: Oh, shit!
The cruiser PUNCHES through the burning "Paradise" sign, smashing it into fiery pieces! The cruiser charges on down the endless highway, burning of sign swirling in its wake.
From the back seat, Audrey watches the fire recede into t distance.
I can't believe it.   Is it really over...?
Up front Jeep stares out at the dark road ahead.
No...It's just starting...
Burning wreckage everywhere. DRIFTING THROUGH IT until we settle on the SPIKE-SCEPTER stuck firmly in the ground. Flames ring the handle.
The cruiser blazes down the highway.
Charlie cradles the baby, apprehensive. The baby looks up her, smiles. She can't help but smile back at him. Jeep eyes her.
Better not hold him too long. Might get attached.
Charlie looks over, feels his lingering anger.
Look, I'm sorry for what I said to you earlier, `bout you following me around. I didn't mean it.
Nothin' to be sorry about. It's true. I did follow you around. At least now I know there was a good reason.
Charlie's reacts, a bit stung. Jeep tries to hide his pleasure that the tables have turn at least a little. Charlie is about to respond when Audre leans in from the back seat.
We're here.
She points ahead to a beaten up road sign that says: "Now Entering Red Rock National Park, Next Rest Stop 30
Okay, all we gotta do is --
The roof buckles above them.   The windows BLOW OUT.

head_text.subj: GABRIEL SMASHES DOWN ON THE CRUISER'S ROOF WITH MASSIVE
USING HIS MIGHTY WINGS FOR BALANCE HE BEGINS TO STOMP ON
ROOF, CRUSHING IT DOWN AS IF IT WERE A SODA CAN

text: Jeep, Charlie and Audrey slip frantically down in their s as the roof presses down at them. The windows BURST. Jeep grabs the Glock and fires wildly up at the roof.
Gabriel takes a direct hit in the thigh, causing him to s off the roof and onto the trunk where he grabs a hold of rear window frame for support.
With tremendous strength, Gabriel pulls his upper body through the broken back window toward Audrey.
Jeep!
Jeep swings the gun around.
Duck!
BLAM! Gabriel takes one in the shoulder, but it doesn't s him down.
Audrey, the flare gun!

Audrey desperately tries to load a flare while avoiding Gabriel's grasp. Jeep can't get off another shot without risk of hitting Audrey. Gabriel is almost entirely in the car now. Audrey swings the flare gun toward Gabriel, but he knocks hand aside just as she pulls the trigger and the flare go off INSIDE THE CAR! Jeep ducks. The CAR SWERVES MADLY. The flare RICOCHETS through the cabin, lighting it up like the Fourth of July Gabriel lunges for Charlie just as the flare bounces off windshield - PING! - and nails him right in the face, SET HIS HAIR ABLAZE. And that gives Jeep the chance to swing around and FIRE. BOOM! Gabriel is blown back partially through the rear window. He holds onto the car with an iron grip. Starts t pull himself back in. Nothing slows this guy down. Jeep pulls the trigger again and...CLICK.    No bullets! Audrey frantically reloads the flare gun. Brings it up to fire, but he's too fast! WHACK! Gabriel knocks her into t side of the car with a sweep of his hand. She's out cold.
Now he's clawing his way unobstructed toward Charlie agai Jeep knows there's only one thing to do.
Get down on the floor!

Charlie pushes herself and the baby down on the floor in front of the passenger seat. Jeep PUNCHES IT.   The speedometer leaps ahead. 70...80...90... Gabriel's now completely in the car.   They're helpless. Gabriel lunges over the passenger seat, grasping for Char his ferocious hand only inches from her and the baby, whe
Get off her, you fucking asshole!
Audrey leaps onto Gabriel, pulling him away from Charlie in time. He flails wildly about but this young girl rides him like one helluva a cowboy. 100...110...120...
Do it, Jeep! Do it now!

head_text.subj: JEEP SLAMS ON THE BREAKS, SENDING GABRIEL AND AUDREY SHOO
FORWARD THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD LIKE A BULLET.

text: The intertwined bodies of Gabriel and Audrey hit the road with a sickening crunch and ROLL INTO A BALL OF FIRE.
The Cruiser spins out of control, swerving off the road a careening into a large rock formation. This ride is over.
Jeep's side of the car is crushed.   Blood is running dow forehead. Charlie crawls up from the floor.
C'mon, Jeep!
He tries to focus on her.
Jeep!
She kicks open her door and begins pulling him out.
The baby?
Alive.
And what about...
Nothing could have survived that.
(ANGUISHED) Audrey...
She saved us, Jeep. Audrey saved us. Now c'mon, we gotta go!
Charlie, the baby bundled in her hands, leads Jeep away f the demolished Cruiser.
Jeep and Charlie, battered and bruised, struggle to make long climb up the ridge. Charlie looks up. STARS completely fill the pre-dawn sky.   Breathtaking.
How can this happen?
What?
How can this happen in a world so beautiful?
Jeep follows her gaze to the sky. Endless stars.    Confounding. Jeep shifts his eyes to the TOP OF THE RIDGE just ahead.
C'mon, we're almost there.
They are only a few steps from the EDGE OF THE RIDGE when

head_text.subj: GABRIEL ROCKETS UP IN FRONT OF THEM

text: Charlie screams! Jeep pushes her and the baby out of the just as Gabriel comes down hard in front of them, kicking a cloud of dust. Gabriel's mechanical wings haltingly retract. The crash h done some serious damage. Much of his skin has burned awa Chunks of his armor and flesh are missing as well, includ a large part of his head, revealing that under his human visage is a NIGHTMARISH CREATURE. Gabriel charges at Jeep fast. Jeep whips up his Glock, BL Gabriel takes the bullet, then slaps the gun out of Jeep' hand. Jeep throws a wild punch, connects with Gabriel's chin, rocking him back. More annoyed than surprised, Gabriel knocks Jeep savagely to the ground. Jeep struggles quickly to his feet, comes right back at Gabriel swinging. But Gabriel simply knocks him to the di again. Jeep slowly gets up once more, bleeding, hurt.   Raises h fists. This kid will simply not give up. Jeep moves in again, swinging hard, but Gabriel blocks it shoots out a hand and grabs Jeep by throat, lifting him c off the ground.
So brave. So pointless. You should have worried more about saving yourself.
Jeep's feet dangle. His eyes bulge out. He claws at Gabriel's iron-fast grip, but there's no hope. Charlie watches in horror.
Stop!   Please! Don't kill him!
But Gabriel is doing just that. Jeep is rapidly losing consciousness. The battle is lost.
Go to sleep...
Jeep's eyes flutter.   He's almost gone.
Stop it!   I'LL GIVE YOU THE BABY!
This gets Gabriel's attention. Charlie climbs to her feet, holding the bloody bundle out him.
I don't want this responsibility!
Tears run down her face.   She's dead fucking serious. Gabriel lets go of Jeep.   He falls to the ground, gaspin desperately for air.
Charlie, no!
Gabriel takes the bundle from Charlie, turning away from
"And as the child's cries are extinguished, an eternal darkness at last descended upon the world."
He peels the cloth back, revealing... THE GRENADE. He spins around to face Charlie. She's holding the pin.

head_text.subj: GABRIEL IS BLOWN TO BLOODY BITS.

text: The creature is gone at last. The sound of a BABY COOING. Charlie picks the child up out of the brush. She helps Jeep to his feet and together they slowly make their way to the top of the ridge.
Jeep and Charlie stand overlooking the desert valley belo ON THEIR FACES, reacting to what they see. Charlie takes Jeep's hand in hers.
We made it.
Yep, we sure did.
And now we see it too:
Vast.   Barren.   No signs of life. No resistance force.    No nothing.
Taking it in.     Breathing hard.
I'm sure they're just over the next ridge.
He glances at Charlie.    Worry in her eyes.
What if we're on our own now?
Don't be afraid.    We'll be okay.
Believe me.

At those words, Charlie looks deep into Jeep's eyes. confidence in them she's never seen before. And she leans in and kisses him.      Tender. When they part, Jeep stares back at her with surprise. the surprise melts into a smile. And they descend the ridge...out of sight, leaving us wit view once again of --
A BLOOD RED SUN rises behind the distant mountains. The unbearable cold will soon become an unbearable heat. And we're back where we started. A YOUNG WOMAN'S VOICE.    Solemn.   Weary.   Determined.
Someday when my son is older, I will tell him about the time of his birth when all the world was covered in a great darkness...

Jeep is at the wheel. He looks aged, scarred from the experience. His exposed arms are completely covered with INTRICATE WRITING...The Instructions. The boy he once was gone at last and the warrior protector has replaced him.
... And how just at the moment when everything seemed lost...
Charlie sits across from him, the baby cradled in her arm It's strange, but you might actually mistake them for a h family. Of course you'll have to ignore the ARSENAL OF WEAPONRY in the back seat.
...a mighty warrior fell in order to save me.
Jeep glances over at Charlie and the baby.   He smiles at image of maternal bliss.
And a boy faced his fear and rose up to save us all.
The sun shines through the car windows, filling our eyes its fiery light.
